answers.answer: My blood pressure was extremely high, 193/120! The doc started me on Labetalol immediately bc she was worried about preeclampsia. Other than medication eat less cured, pickled, or other foods with high salt content and drink plenty of water and light exercise should help.

Ive just been prescribed a low dose of aspirin. I'm 22 weeks. My consultant said I should of had it from the beginning. I was induced with my first due to high BP on my due date as it just wouldn't go down

Basically that's all u can do to possibly lower your bp- watch the intake of salts; medicate it; n light exercise; and definitely try to elevetate all stress; definitely continue to monitor your bp at home; preclampsia can lead into strokes

Sorry for the delay but I've been really sick. Ok thanks. I can't exercise because I'm always on strict bed rest, so the only thing I have to rely on is the medicine.  I watch my salt intake, but I could do better so I'll be limiting my processed foods.
Maddiemommie14 thank you. My previous response was for you.
Natjayne I really hope the aspirin helps. I first started experiencing this when I was pregnant with my 6 year old, so I'm trying to get it under control before I end up worse off.
Redd28 thank you.  I'm going to take your advice.  I hate I can't exercise. I have a Dr's appointment tomorrow and I'm sure she'll want to talk about it,  so we will see what she says.

question: Is anyone else experiencing High Blood Pressure?  If so how are you treating it?
title: High Blood Pressure?
